page.title: 01Rose Ness
page.content: Rose Ness point is the south west point of the east mainland of Orkney. The ground is level with a peat soil with a grass and heather cover. Some peat cutting has taken place but the land is now used as rough grazing for sheep. The cliffs are neatly verticle with several spectacular gullies and geos. The southern tip of Rose Ness has a gas powered automatic lighthouse marking the enterence to Holm Sound. About 300 meteres to the north east is a stone built beacon with a cross on top this was erected in the 19th centuary to mark the enterence to Holm Sound before the lighthouse was constructed.
